message.content:
cs.NI, cs.DC, cs.DS, cs.SI, cs.IT 

This paper discusses the design of a novel architecture for supporting multicast services in large-scale ad hoc networks. The paper focuses on the networking aspects of the architecture, including routing, address allocation, and bootstrap mechanisms. Therefore, the most likely arXiv CS sub-category for this paper is cs.NI (Networking and Internet Architecture). Additionally, the paper discusses the scalability, robustness, and efficiency of the proposed architecture, which are important topics in distributed computing (cs.DC) and data structures and algorithms (cs.DS). The paper also introduces new metrics for stability and mobility, which are relevant to the field of social networks and computational social science (cs.SI). Finally, the paper proposes a geographic-based multicast address allocation scheme, which is related to information theory (cs.IT).
